page.title: 01THE CHANGING FACE OF ACLE
page.content: ACLE IS A MARKET TOWN OF ABOUT 2000 PEOPLE SITUATED ON A LOW CHALK RIDGE,OVERLOOKING TO THE EAST THE FLAT PLAIN OF THE RIVERS BURE AND YARE. THIRTY YEARS AGO THIS AREA WAS GRAZING MARSH AND REED SWAMPS,VIRTUALLY UNCHANGED SINCE THE SEVENTEENTH CENTURY.NOW MODERN DRAINAGE METHODS AND GOVERNMENT SUBSIDIES HAVE BROUGHT MANY ACRES UNDER THE PLOUGH,THE CHIEF CROPS BEING CEREALS AND BEET.SOME GRAZING OF SHEEP AND CATTLE STILL OCCURS,BUT THE CHARACTER OF THE AREA IS CHANGING RAPIDILY.ALTHOUGH A DESIGNATED "AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL INTEREST"MANY SPECIES OF PLANT AND ANIMAL ARE UNDER THREAT,AND THIS, PLUS THE PROJECTED 1986 BY_PASS ,ARE MAIN TOPICS OF LOCAL CONVERSATION.BOTH HERE AND IN THE VILLAGE OF STOKESBY FEWER PEOPLE NOW WORK ON THE LAND,MOST COMMUTING TO NORWICH OR YARMOUTH.
